Description: The Department of Justice's U.S. Trustee Program entered into a multi-district settlement agreement with global consulting firm McKinsey & Company, Inc., resolving disputes over the adequacy of McKinsey's disclosures of connections in Chapter 11 bankruptcy cases.
failure to pay out-of-state business registration fee

Primary Offense: off-label or unapproved promotion of medical products
Description: McKinsey & Company agreed to pay 47 states, the District of Columbia, and five U.S. territories a total of $573 million in settlement of allegations it advised opioid manufacturers how to maximize profit from opioid products by targeting high-volume prescribers, promoting physicians to prescribe more opioids, and circumvent pharmacy restrictions.
